series_description: This series documents the data collected in field studies by regional staff for all programs, including watershed monitoring, Chesapeake Bay Program (CBP), Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) monitoring, and other special studies. This series may include, but is not limited to: worksheets
This series documents pollution complaints and any actions taken to resolve them. This series may include, but is not limited to: correspondence and reports.

series_title: Special Studies: Final Reports Thisseriesdocumentstheoutcomeofspecialstudies completed by regional offices. This series may include, but is not limited to: final reports. COV 10.1-1183

series_description: This series documents the work of special studies completed regional offices. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports.COV10.1-1183
This series documents permittees' management of surface water stocks. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports

series_title: Water Quality Assessment and Monitoring Reporting
series_description: This series documents the compilation of the required biennial 305(b) and 303(d) report to the U. S. Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA). This series may include, but is not limited reports and other supporting documentation

This series documents studies to attain and/or maintain watershed quality and clean-up, including the process of creating the studies and the outcomes and analyses of accomplishments thereof, programmatic guidance and for Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) implementation, Nonpoint Source Management, watershed cleanup, nesting rationales, and natural conditions rationales. This series may include, but is not limited to: plans, reports, articles, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 0 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

series_title: WatershedCleanup: No-DischargeZones(NDZ)andTotal Maximum Daily Loads (TMDL) Development
series_description: This series documents the process and outcome of watershed Daily Loads (TMDL) and No-Discharge Zones (NDZ). This series may include, but is not limited to: applications, reports, articles, plans, and correspondence
